warning.para: OmegaT is a robust and trustworthy application, but even so, it is smart take precautions to guard against data loss when using it, just as with any other application.

section.title: Automatic backups
section.para: OmegaT regularly and automatically stores all your progress in the file located in the project’s folder. OmegaT also creates regular backups of that file.

listitem.para: When you open a project, OmegaT backs-up project_save.tmx into a timestamped backup file.
OmegaT keeps up to 10 of those files.

note.para: The backup filename follows the pattern project_save.tmx.YYYYMMDDhhmm.bak where YYYY represents the 4-digit year, MM the month, DD the day of the month, and hh and mm indicate the hours and minutes.

listitem.para: Every time project_save.tmx has been modified: either after using , or as a regular backup every 3 minutes by default, OmegaT creates a backup with the name project_save.tmx.bak. That file is a copy of project_save.tmx before the modification.
Everytime you use , or as a regular backup every 3 minutes by default, OmegaT saves the current state of the translation into project_save.tmx

section.para: The file project_save.tmx always contains the most recent data.

section.title: You lost your translation?
section.para: If you believe that you have lost translation data, it might probably be safely stored in your most recent backup memory, which is usually less than a few minutes old or so.

Proceed as follows:
Close the project, preventing on any modification on the current status of the backup files.
Rename the current project_save.tmx file (to project_save.tmx.tmp, for example).
Select the backup translation memory most likely to contain the data you are looking for.
Rename it project_save.tmx.
Reopen the project.

This action will restore the status of the translation to the moment on which the selected backup was created. You may repeat this operation as needed for locating older situations. Keep an eye on safely storing all the different files you are renaming for eventual reuse. Also remember not modifying the project configuration or adding TMX files on the meantime, as that may affect the results.

section.title: Your project won't open?
section.para: In rare cases where your computer freezes and OmegaT does not have the time to properly close, some important files can be broken and keep your project from reopening after you have rebooted your machine.

Proceed as follows:
Create a new project with the same settings.
Copy the contents of the various user folders to their equivalent in the new project (source files, reference translation memory files, glossary files).
In the old project, select the translation memory (backup or not) most likely to contain the data you are looking for.
Rename it project_save.tmx.
Copy it to the omegat/ folder of your new project.
Open the new project the project.
This action will restore in the new project the status of the translation to the moment on which the selected project translation memory was created in the old project.

section.title: Your translated file won't open?
section.para: Very often, office suite files contain tags that must be copied into the translation to ensure that the translated file can be opened in the original application. In some cases, missing tags will keep the file from opening.

Proceed as follows:
Open the project in OmegaT.
Use and focus on Tag issues .
Fix all the tag issues that were found in your documents.
Use to recreate the documents.
Open the documents again in the original application.
This action will fix the internal tag consistency issues that might have been induced by not properly inserting the tags in the translation while in OmegaT.

listitem.para: To avoid losing important data, make regular copies of the file /omegat/project_save.tmx to a backup media, such as a USB key or an external hard drive, or to a cloud service.
Practice regularly "emergency" measures, like restoring translations from a project, to make sure you won't lose too much time the day you need to use those skills.
You can control the frequency of the file saving in the Preferences – .

note.para: Be very cautious about making changes to the files in the source folder, to the segmentation rules, or to the file filters, partway through a project. Modifying either after you have started your translation could result in OmegaT becoming unable to find a segment that you have already translated.
